_comment: Created by ianb on 27/06/2014 16:15:01 using v2.1
title: How has the absolute number of adults joining NHS stop smoking services changed?
analysis_commentary: We've seen previously that the percentage of successful quitters has generally decreased over time, however the number of adults joining the service and the number of successful quitters has increased. Although the data is not shown here, numbers each quarter again reveal clear peaks at the start of each year for both measures, with a relatively higher number of people joining and quitting between January and March. Although the annual trend has generally increased, we do see a dip in the number of people joining and successfully quitting in 2012/13. So it seems that though the success rate for those who decide to quit is improving, the actual number of people quitting has dropped slightly.
data_source: Health & Social Care Information Centre, Statistics on NHS Stop Smoking Services in England
